Class Polynomial

  • java.lang.Object
    • Polynomial

  • public class Polynomial
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for representing polynomials, along with basic operations performable on them and a method to parse a polynomial from a string.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jayson Rook

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Polynomial()
      Creates a zero polynomial (0x^1).
      Polynomial(int[] coeffs, int[] exps)
      Creates a polynomial from two arrays, representing coefficient / exponent pairs for the terms of the polynomial.
      Polynomial(Polynomial p)
      Copy constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Polynomial add(Polynomial p)
      Returns the polynomial resulting from the addition of this and another polynomial, without modifying either of the originals.
      boolean equals(Polynomial p)
      Returns true iff this and another polynomial are logically equivalent.
      double evaluate(double x)
      Computes the value of this polynomial for a particular value of x.
      Polynomial multiply(Polynomial p)
      Returns the polynomial resulting from the multiplication of this and another polynomial, without modifying either of the originals.
      Polynomial negate()
      Returns the negation of this polynomial, without modifying it.
      static Polynomial parse(java.lang.String str)
      Creates a polynomial from a valid string representation of it
      Polynomial subtract(Polynomial p)
      Returns the polynomial that results when another polynomial is subtracted from this one, without modifying either of the originals.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Creates a string representation of the polynomial, with terms in descending order of exponent, no zero terms, and no duplicate exponents.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        Creates a zero polynomial (0x^1).

                  int[] exps)
        Creates a polynomial from two arrays, representing coefficient / exponent pairs for the terms of the polynomial.
        Parameters:
        coeffs - the array of coefficients
        exps - the array of corresponding exponents

      • add

        public Polynomial add(Polynomial p)
        Returns the polynomial resulting from the addition of this and another polynomial, without modifying either of the originals.
        Parameters:
        p - the polynomial added to this one
        Returns:
        the polynomial representing the sum

      • multiply

        public Polynomial multiply(Polynomial p)
        Returns the polynomial resulting from the multiplication of this and another polynomial, without modifying either of the originals.
        Parameters:
        p - the polynomial multiplied to this one
        Returns:
        the polynomial representing the product

      • negate

        public Polynomial negate()
        Returns the negation of this polynomial, without modifying it.
        Returns:
        the negation of this polynomial

      • subtract

        public Polynomial subtract(Polynomial p)
        Returns the polynomial that results when another polynomial is subtracted from this one, without modifying either of the originals.
        Parameters:
        p - the polynomial subtracted from this one
        Returns:
        the polynomial representing the difference

      • evaluate

        public double evaluate(double x)
        Computes the value of this polynomial for a particular value of x.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x in the computation
        Returns:
        the computed value

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Polynomial p)
        Returns true iff this and another polynomial are logically equivalent.
        Parameters:
        p - the polynomial to compare with this one
        Returns:
        true iff the two polynomials are equal

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a string representation of the polynomial, with terms in descending order of exponent, no zero terms, and no duplicate exponents.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
